Let— $y = 	ext{log } x$, so that $x = e^{y}$.
Now by $y$ and consequently by considering the limiting values of these functions.
We wish to find $ rac{dy}{dx}$ and we have already obtained an expression for

blocks.description: This is the derivative of y with respect to x.
This is the expression of dy/dx in terms of y.
This indicates the derivative of the logarithmic function.

blocks.text: for, in accordance with the rule given on p. 48, the A which multiplies the I.V. in the original function must appear as a multiplier after differentiation.
